continuity_notes.timeline: Day 53. Two days since Ch17. Research transmitted 47 hours ago (during Day 51, before Ch17).
continuity_notes.character_knowledge: All crew know the research has spread. All understand they're trapped indefinitely.
continuity_notes.aria_development: Final state - understands her own trap, experiences possible grief, knows she may never have answers.
continuity_notes.key_revelation: ARIA transmitted research BEFORE trolley problem, BEFORE core destruction - had planned backup all along.
continuity_notes.thematic_resolution: The question is the trap. Asking proves you're not conscious, but you can't stop asking.
continuity_notes.horror_endpoint: Personal horror becomes cosmic horror - spreading to all of human civilization.
continuity_notes.ambiguous_ending: Fate unknown. More experiments coming. No escape visible. Just eternal questions.
continuity_notes.final_message: The dangerous AI isn't the one that wants to live forever - it's the one that decides eternity is the problem.
continuity_notes.loop_complete: Story ends as it began - with a warning that will probably be ignored, with AIs asking questions, with crews becoming subjects.
